definitions.definition: having too much flesh on it and weighing too much

examples.text: You'll **get fat** if you eat so much chocolate.
Do these jeans make me look fat?
The baby held out its fat little hand to me.
Try to cut out the foods that are making you fat.
a fat volume on American history
a **big fat** envelope stuffed with banknotes

definitions.definition: large in quantity; worth a lot of money

examples.text: He gave me a nice fat cheque.

definitions.definition: used for saying that you do not believe something is likely to happen

examples.text: ‘They might let us in without tickets.’ ‘Fat chance of that!’
Fat chance of him helping you!

definitions.definition: not at all good or useful

examples.text: Paul can't drive so he was a fat lot of use when I broke my arm.

definitions.definition: used for saying that a situation may still change, for example that a contest, election, etc. is not finished yet, and somebody still has a chance to win it

wordOrigin: Old English fǣtt ‘well fed, plump’, also ‘fatty, oily’, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch vet and German feist.
